metadata.name: KnowledgeBase.LearningsIndex
metadata.description: Index map for retrieving established patterns and critical learnings.

retrieval-protocol.title: AI Utilization Strategy
retrieval-protocol.ai-directive: AI Agents MUST consult this index before task execution to avoid known regressions.

workflow.step: 1. Analyze the task description for relevant keywords/domains.
2. Query this index for matching categories.
3. Prioritize and integrate the `` elements into the execution plan.
4. If necessary, retrieve the detailed learning file using the `path` attribute.

category.name: Authentication/OAuth
category.keywords: JWT, Login, Session, OAuth, Token
category.critical-takeaway: MANDATORY: All services must integrate with the shared auth service (SPEC/shared_auth_integration.xml).
Ensure consistent JWT secret configuration across services (jwt-secret-mismatch).
OAuth redirect URIs must point to auth service (auth.staging.netrasystems.ai), not frontend (oauth_redirect_configuration.xml).
Frontend pages receiving OAuth tokens via URL must handle token extraction and storage (oauth_token_persistence.xml).
Always verify OAuth configuration matches between code and provider console (oauth_deployment_verification.xml).
Next.js proxy rewrites must be disabled in production - frontend should call services directly (oauth_staging_issues.xml).
Auth service routes ALWAYS use /auth/* prefix - frontend must include this (frontend_auth_urls.xml).

category.name: Auth Service Integration
category.keywords: Auth Service, Dev Login, JWT, OAuth Flow
category.critical-takeaway: Auth service is OAuth-first with NO /register endpoint - use OAuth or dev login.
Dev login endpoint (/auth/dev/login) creates fixed dev@example.com user automatically.
Auth service maintains separate auth_users table but syncs IDs with main database.
Token validation via POST /auth/validate, not a TokenValidator class.
Redis sessions optional in dev/staging - service healthy without Redis.
Auth service MUST use unified configuration via lazy loading pattern while maintaining service independence (unified_config_auth_service.xml).

category.name: Staging Authentication Failures [CRITICAL]
category.keywords: Staging, Authentication, 403 Forbidden, Service-to-Service, Token Refresh, JWT Secret, OAuth
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Authentication failures in staging indicate imminent production failures that will cause complete platform unavailability and 100% revenue loss.
MANDATORY: All authentication tests must run in staging environment (@pytest.mark.env("staging")) to catch environment-specific configuration issues.
Frontend gets 403 Forbidden when calling backend threads endpoint due to service account authentication failure and JWT secret mismatch.
Service-to-service authentication completely broken between frontend-backend and backend-auth services - microservice architecture non-functional.
Token refresh mechanism completely non-functional - users cannot maintain sessions and are forced to re-authenticate repeatedly.
JWT secret synchronization failure between services causes valid tokens to be rejected across service boundaries.
OAuth configuration misconfigured in staging preventing new user registration and social login - no user acquisition possible.
CORS configuration blocks legitimate cross-service authentication requests causing service communication failures.

category.name: Auth Service Staging Log Issues [HIGH PRIORITY]
category.keywords: HEAD Method, HTTP 405, Monitoring, Database Initialization, Idempotency, UniqueViolationError
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Health endpoints must support HEAD requests - monitoring systems fail with 405 Method Not Allowed causing false alerts.
Database initialization must be idempotent - UniqueViolationError warnings indicate potential startup fragility.
All monitoring endpoints (/health, /auth/health, /readiness, /docs) must support HEAD method for monitoring compatibility.
HEAD responses must have same headers as GET but empty body per HTTP specification.
Database initialization should use IF NOT EXISTS patterns and handle concurrent initialization gracefully.
Test HTTP method compatibility with common monitoring system user agents (Kubernetes, GCP Load Balancer, AWS ALB, Datadog).

category.name: Database Connectivity Critical Fix [RESOLVED]
category.keywords: Database, Postgres, Connection, POSTGRES_DB, netra_dev, staging
category.critical-takeaway: RESOLVED 2025-08-25: Fixed critical 'database postgres does not exist' error by updating POSTGRES_DB configuration.
NEVER use 'postgres' system database name for application data - use 'netra_dev' for staging and development.
All environments must use consistent database naming: dev/staging='netra_dev', test='netra_test', prod='netra_production'.
Configuration alignment is critical: .env files, deployment scripts, and Secret Manager must all use same database names.
Silent "staging mode" fallback hides critical database issues - prefer fail-fast behavior for database connectivity problems.
Pre-deployment validation must include database existence and connectivity tests with actual environment credentials.

category.name: API Versioning Anti-Pattern [RESOLVED]
category.keywords: API, v1, versioning, URLs, paths, REST
category.critical-takeaway: RESOLVED 2025-08-25: All v1 references have been removed from all services.
Auth service now uses clean /auth/* paths (no /api/v1/auth/*).
Backend uses consistent /api/* paths without version prefixes.
Frontend simplified - no version logic needed, uses clean paths.
For internal microservices, version through deployment strategies, not URLs.
URLs are now clean and semantic: auth.domain/auth/*, api.domain/api/*.

category.name: Deployment Performance Testing
category.keywords: Deployment, Performance, Startup, Memory, CPU, Health, Timeout, Resource Optimization
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Deployment performance tests prevent timeout failures and validate resource optimization compliance.
Startup timeout prevention requires comprehensive testing with 60-second Cloud Run limits.
Memory optimization from 2Gi to 1Gi requires extensive validation with leak detection.
Health endpoints must respond within 100ms for deployment readiness validation.
Edge case testing covers memory pressure, CPU throttling, and cascading timeout scenarios.
Performance monitoring must be integrated into deployment pipelines for regression detection.
Container startup probes require comprehensive success/failure/recovery testing.

category.name: Project Structure
category.keywords: Structure, Imports, netra_backend, Canonical
category.critical-takeaway: THE canonical structure: netra_backend/app/ for production, netra_backend/tests/ for tests. This is PERMANENT.
All imports MUST use netra_backend.app.* prefix. Fix imports, NOT the structure.
Cross-service imports are FORBIDDEN. Use API clients for service communication.
When imports fail, update them to match structure. NEVER move files to accommodate old patterns.
Test runner uses netra_backend/tests/, dev launcher uses netra_backend.app.main:app.

category.name: Microservice Environment Independence
category.keywords: Environment, IsolatedEnvironment, dev_launcher, Service Independence, Cross-Service
category.critical-takeaway: NEVER import environment management from dev_launcher - each service MUST have its own isolated_environment.
Service-local implementations of shared patterns are acceptable and required for independence.
Always provide production fallback patterns when development modules may not be available.

category.name: SSOT Auth Service Remediation [RESOLVED]
category.keywords: SSOT, Single Source of Truth, Duplication, Auth Service, Database Connection, JWT, Environment Variables
category.critical-takeaway: RESOLVED 2025-08-25: Fixed critical SSOT violations in auth_service - removed 365+ lines of duplicate code.
AuthDatabaseManager is the canonical database connection implementation - all operations delegate to it.
JWTHandler.validate_token() is the single source of truth for JWT validation - removed duplicate validation logic.
IsolatedEnvironment.get_env().get() is the ONLY way to access environment variables - replaced 40+ os.getenv() calls.
Backward compatibility maintained through delegation patterns and aliases during SSOT remediation.
Regular SSOT audits essential - violations accumulate quickly without strict enforcement.
netra_backend MUST use netra_backend.app.core.isolated_environment, NOT dev_launcher.isolated_environment.
Remove all service discovery imports from dev_launcher in production services.

category.name: AI-Native Path Management
category.keywords: AI-Native, Path Migration, Refactoring, Service Creation, Batch Operations, Import Management
category.critical-takeaway: ALWAYS use batch operations for path migrations - never migrate file-by-file to avoid inconsistencies.
Path migrations must be atomic - all changes in single commit with tests passing before and after.
Use multi-agent coordination for large migrations: Principal (strategy), Implementation (execution), QA (verification), DevOps (deployment).

category.name: Import Refactoring Crisis
category.keywords: Import Errors, ModuleNotFoundError, Refactoring, PerformanceMonitor, ConnectionManager, BackgroundTaskManager, ATOMIC SCOPE
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: 330+ import errors from non-atomic refactoring. Refactors MUST update tests in same commit.
PerformanceMonitor moved from monitoring.performance_monitor to monitoring.metrics_collector (23 files affected).
ConnectionManager renamed to WebSocketManager in websocket_core module (22 files affected).
BackgroundTaskManager moved from app.background to app.services.background_task_manager (6 files affected).
Create backward compatibility stubs when removing modules to prevent import failures during transition.
Add pytest --collect-only to CI/CD to catch import errors before merge.
New services must follow standard scaffold: {service_name}/{service_name}_core/ structure with health endpoints from start.
Validate import hierarchy: Core->Models->Services->Routes->Main, never reverse imports.
Configuration alignment critical: Update Python imports, Docker paths, CI/CD, env vars atomically.

category.name: WebSocket
category.keywords: Realtime, Coroutine, Async
category.critical-takeaway: All failures MUST raise exceptions. Silent failures (e.g., auth hanging) are forbidden.
Always await async operations. Verify objects are not coroutines before access.
Ensure strict alignment of message fields (e.g., 'content' vs 'text') between FE/BE.

category.name: Configuration/Secrets
category.keywords: Env Vars, .env
category.critical-takeaway: All configuration MUST utilize the unified config system. Direct `os.environ.get()` is forbidden outside the config module.

category.name: Unified Configuration
category.keywords: Config, Hot Reload, ConfigManager, Configuration, Secrets, GCP
category.critical-takeaway: Configuration MUST use single source of truth at netra_backend.app.config. 110+ redundant implementations have been REMOVED to maintain SSOT.
NEVER import removed files: config_environment.py, config_loader.py, config_manager.py, config_envvars.py - they're DELETED.
Hot reload enables zero-downtime updates via CONFIG_HOT_RELOAD=true and reload_config().
All configuration access uses: from netra_backend.app.config import get_config.
Configuration validation is MANDATORY: validate_configuration() must pass before deployment.
Secrets use unified SecretManager with GCP Secret Manager (staging/production) or local files (dev).

category.name: Secret Manager Interface
category.keywords: SecretManager, load_all_secrets, Interface Contract, UnifiedSecretManager
category.critical-takeaway: SecretManager MUST provide public load_all_secrets() method for UnifiedSecretManager compatibility.

category.name: Configuration Issues 2025
category.keywords: DATABASE_URL, ClickHouse, Redis, Environment Detection, Import Paths, WebSocket
category.critical-takeaway: DATABASE_URL must use Cloud SQL format in staging, never localhost fallback - staging configuration failures indicate production readiness issues.
Redis fallback to localhost must be disabled in staging/production via REDIS_FALLBACK_ENABLED=false environment variable.
Import paths: ClickHouseClient moved to data_sub_agent module, RedisClient is RedisManager, WebSocket imports use fastapi not starlette.
IsolatedEnvironment singleton requires instance reset when testing different environment configurations.
Service client connection tests must use async patterns: asyncio.run(client.connect()) for ClickHouse, asyncio.run(client.ping()) for Redis.
Never access private methods (_method) from external components - use public interfaces.
Secret loading failures should log warnings but NOT crash the application.
Always write interface contract tests when creating component dependencies.

category.name: CORS/Dynamic Ports
category.keywords: CORS, Dynamic Ports, Localhost, Development
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: CORS configuration MUST support dynamic ports in development. Pattern matching for localhost with ANY port must be checked FIRST.
Use DynamicCORSMiddleware when CORS_ORIGINS=* to handle credentials properly (RFC 6454).

category.name: Testing
category.keywords: TDD, Feature Flags, Pytest, Jest, Test Discovery, Test Runner, Environment Testing
category.critical-takeaway: Adhere to the Feature Flag TDD workflow (feature-flags-tdd-workflow).
Tests must validate REAL functionality, not mocks (frontend-test-paradox-report).
All test directories MUST be added to test_scanners.py for discovery (test-discovery-all-directories).
Tests MUST declare environment compatibility using @env markers (environment_aware_testing.xml).
Production tests require @env_safe decorator and ALLOW_PROD_TESTS flag.
Test runner requires PROJECT_ROOT in sys.path for imports (test-import-project-root).

category.name: Frontend Staging Errors (Five Whys)
category.keywords: Five Whys, Type Conflicts, SSOT, Authentication, HTTPS, Mixed Content, Root Cause, Frontend, Staging
category.critical-takeaway: Multiple type exports violate SSOT - maintain ONE canonical definition per type, delete all legacy implementations.
Landing page auth failures often test mock issues - ensure mocks match actual import patterns.
Mixed content HTTPS enforcement requires consistent client/server environment detection.
Five Whys reveals true root causes 4-5 levels deep - most errors NOT what they first seem.
Incomplete atomic refactoring causes most staging errors - enforce complete migrations.
Create failing tests BEFORE fixing to validate root cause understanding.

category.name: Test Infrastructure Unification
category.keywords: Test Runner, Unified Testing, Test Framework, Test Plumbing
category.critical-takeaway: Use unified_test_runner.py in root as single entry point for ALL test operations.
Test infrastructure (runners, configs) centralized in root/test_framework/, test files remain in service directories.
Service differences abstracted via SERVICE_CONFIGS - same interface for pytest/jest backends.
Import paths must be updated systematically when consolidating - use migration scripts for large refactors.
Maintain backwards compatibility during migrations with wrapper scripts and deprecation warnings.

category.name: PostgreSQL Duplication Resolution
category.keywords: PostgreSQL, Database, Connection, Duplication, pytest, URL normalization, SSL, Cloud SQL
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: NEVER use pytest detection in production code - causes test/production divergence
Database URL normalization must have exactly ONE implementation in DatabaseURLBuilder
All environment variable access must go through unified configuration
SSL parameter handling centralized in DatabaseURLBuilder.format_url_for_driver()
Cloud SQL detection uses DatabaseURLBuilder.cloud_sql.is_cloud_sql exclusively
Test and production code paths MUST be identical - no conditional logic based on test detection

category.name: WebSocket Consolidation
category.keywords: websocket, SSOT, consolidation, heartbeat, lifecycle, message queue, single source of truth
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Every functionality must have exactly ONE canonical implementation per SSOT - use composition/configuration, not multiple implementations.
SSOT violations grow exponentially - a single wrapper spawned 8 implementations causing 2,100+ redundant lines.
Always extend existing implementations with options/parameters instead of creating specialized variants.
Backward compatibility aliases enable zero-downtime consolidation - always provide migration path.
Run weekly duplicate detection: python scripts/detect_duplicate_code.py --threshold 0.8
Any new manager/service/handler class requires architecture review to prevent duplication.

category.name: WebSocket Legacy Cleanup
category.keywords: websocket, legacy imports, large_message_handler, startup module, consolidation cleanup
category.critical-takeaway: WebSocket large_message_handler module was removed during consolidation - use get_websocket_manager() instead.
All WebSocket imports MUST use netra_backend.app.websocket_core, not legacy app.websocket.* paths.
Message size validation now in auth module: validate_message_size() with 8192 byte default.
After architecture consolidation, systematically audit all imports to prevent runtime failures.
Graceful startup mode logs warnings for optional service failures instead of crashing.

category.name: Test Infrastructure Repair
category.keywords: Integration Tests, Import Errors, Async Tests, Test Collection, pytest.mark.asyncio
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: All async test functions MUST have @pytest.mark.asyncio decorator or tests will hang/timeout.
All imports MUST be absolute starting from package root - NO relative imports in tests.
Missing module exports cause most import errors - ensure __all__ exports in modules.
Create stub implementations for missing modules rather than removing test coverage.
Auth service is UserAuthService not AuthService - import as: from netra_backend.app.services.user_auth_service import UserAuthService as AuthService.
Metrics collector is at netra_backend.app.monitoring.metrics_collector not core.monitoring.
Test config is at netra_backend.tests.integration.config not tests.config.

category.name: Test Imports
category.keywords: Imports, ModuleNotFoundError, PYTHONPATH, Test Setup
category.critical-takeaway: All imports MUST use absolute imports with netra_backend namespace (e.g., from netra_backend.app.db import models).
Auth service endpoints use /auth prefix, NOT /auth.
Use /auth/dev/login for testing (no registration endpoint exists).
Test files use netra_backend.tests.* namespace for test imports.

category.name: Test Environment
category.keywords: Windows, PYTHONPATH, Pytest, Environment
category.critical-takeaway: Set PYTHONPATH explicitly on Windows: set PYTHONPATH=C:\path\to\app
Run tests from app directory for proper import resolution.
Use -m "not real_services" to skip external API calls in tests.
Test size limits: 1000 lines per file, 8 lines per function (many violations exist).

category.name: Test Import Standardization
category.keywords: Test Setup, sys.path, Imports, SSOT, setup_test_path
category.critical-takeaway: NEVER write manual sys.path manipulation in test files - use setup_test_path() from netra_backend.tests.test_utils
500+ test files contained redundant path setup code violating SSOT - ALL must use centralized function
Import order: stdlib -> third-party -> setup_test_path() -> project imports
Manual PROJECT_ROOT manipulation is FORBIDDEN - violates SSOT principle

category.name: Frontend
category.keywords: Zustand, React, TypeScript
category.critical-takeaway: Use individual selectors to prevent infinite loops. See SPEC/conventions.xml#zustand-selectors.

category.name: Microservice Independence
category.keywords: Microservice, Docker, Service
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Microservices MUST be 100% independent. NO imports from the main `netra_backend/app/` module. Do not name internal modules 'app'.

category.name: Health Checks
category.keywords: Health, Ready, Readiness, Liveness
category.critical-takeaway: Health check endpoints must initialize database connections lazily if not already initialized.
Auth service requires /health/ready endpoint on configured port (8080 default, not 8001).
Database health checks must handle uninitialized async_engine gracefully by calling initialize_postgres().
Backend has TWO health implementations: active health.py at /health prefix and unused unified_health.py - /health/ready endpoint exists at /health/ready.
Health route registration uses health.py module (not unified_health.py) with endpoints: /health/, /health/ready, /health/live and others.

category.name: Database/AsyncIO
category.keywords: AsyncSession, Database, Postgres, ClickHouse
category.critical-takeaway: Functions marked as async must actually await something (postgres-session-async-function-paradox).
ClickHouse driver: Use OperationalError instead of NetworkError (which doesn't exist) for network-related exceptions.

category.name: Database Architecture
category.keywords: Database, Connection, Driver, AsyncPG, Psycopg2, SSL, Cloud SQL, URL, Architecture, Health Check, Authentication, DatabaseManager, IsolatedEnvironment
category.critical-takeaway: Sync drivers (psycopg2) use sslmode= parameter, async drivers (asyncpg) use ssl= parameter - incompatibility causes connection failures.
Cloud SQL Unix socket connections must have NO SSL parameters - SSL is handled at socket level.
Alembic migrations must use sync drivers (psycopg2), not async drivers - prevents greenlet/asyncio compatibility issues.
Use centralized DatabaseManager for URL transformations to ensure driver compatibility and prevent configuration errors.
Environment-aware connection strategy required - local uses TCP, Cloud SQL can use TCP+SSL or Unix sockets without SSL.
Health checkers MUST use DatabaseManager.create_application_engine() - direct async_engine imports cause authentication failures.
Database connections in health checks should create and dispose engines per check to prevent pool exhaustion.
All services MUST use DatabaseManager for database connections to ensure credential consistency from IsolatedEnvironment.

category.name: Database Config Migration
category.keywords: DatabaseConfig, Migration, Unified Config, postgres_events, Configuration Migration
category.critical-takeaway: ALL DatabaseConfig.* references MUST be replaced with get_unified_config().db_* - partial migrations cause deployment failures.
Migration from DatabaseConfig to unified config must be atomic and comprehensive across ALL files.
postgres_events.py must use get_unified_config() instead of DatabaseConfig imports.
Staging deployment reveals configuration issues not caught in local development due to different initialization paths.
Use Five Whys analysis for root cause identification of deployment configuration errors.

category.name: FastAPI/Dependencies
category.keywords: FastAPI, Depends, AsyncContextManager, async with, async for
category.critical-takeaway: Never use @asynccontextmanager decorated functions directly with FastAPI's Depends() - create wrapper functions.
Use 'async with' for @asynccontextmanager functions, NOT 'async for' (context managers != iterators).
Context managers implement __aenter__/__aexit__, iterators implement __aiter__/__anext__.

category.name: Import Management
category.keywords: Imports, ImportError, ModuleNotFoundError, CostOptimizer
category.critical-takeaway: Always use absolute imports starting from netra_backend, never relative imports
When renaming classes, create backwards compatibility aliases (e.g., CostOptimizer = LLMCostOptimizer)
Missing Enum import is common - always check for standard library imports
Use import_management.py for comprehensive import checking and fixing

category.name: Database/Migration
category.keywords: Alembic, Migration, AsyncPG, Greenlet, SQLAlchemy
category.critical-takeaway: Alembic requires synchronous database URL - remove asyncpg driver for migrations.
Separate sync migration URLs from async application URLs to avoid greenlet errors.

category.name: Dev Launcher
category.keywords: Development, Startup, Local, Health Checks, Configuration, LLM, Environment
category.critical-takeaway: CONSOLIDATED: All dev launcher learnings now in single file. SECRET_KEY must be 64+ characters.
Health checks must use dynamic ports from .service_discovery/*.json files.
Extended timeouts required: Backend/Auth 30s, Frontend 60s, Overall 120s.
LLM must stay in "shared" mode even without API keys - do not auto-disable (service_availability_checker.py).
Backend environment loading must avoid circular dependencies - check env vars, not config system (main.py).

category.name: Deployment
category.keywords: GCP, Cloud Run, Docker, Staging, SSL, Database, OAuth, Frontend, Proxy, Gunicorn, Workers
category.critical-takeaway: Use gunicorn with uvicorn workers for Cloud Run (cloud-run-uvicorn-workers).
DATABASE_URL in staging/production MUST include sslmode=require parameter for Cloud SQL connections.
Frontend NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL must point to backend API URL (e.g., https://api.staging.netrasystems.ai) for proxy rewrites to work.
Health check /health/ready endpoint in staging may fail with 503 if database connectivity isn't properly configured - check DATABASE_URL and SSL settings.
OAuth flow requires auth service at separate domain (e.g., auth.staging.netrasystems.ai) with proper CORS and callback URL configuration.
Gunicorn workers require proper lifecycle hooks and tini for signal handling to prevent ProcessLookupError in containers.
CRITICAL: USE_OAUTH_PROXY must be "true" for backend to validate tokens through auth service, even if OAUTH_PROXY_URL is correctly set.

category.name: GitHub Actions
category.keywords: CI/CD, Pipeline, Workflow
category.critical-takeaway: Test failures must propagate - see test-exit-code-propagation learning.

category.name: Architecture/Compliance
category.keywords: 300/8, Compliance, Architecture
category.critical-takeaway: Maintain 450-line file limit and 25-line function limit. Use compliance check script.

category.name: Context Optimization
category.keywords: AI Context, Token Optimization
category.critical-takeaway: Avoid context bloat from test files and long functions. Monitor context efficiency.

category.name: Type Safety
category.keywords: Types, Pydantic, TypeScript
category.critical-takeaway: Maintain single source of truth for types. Avoid circular imports.

category.name: SSOT Consolidation [CRITICAL]
category.keywords: SSOT, Single Source of Truth, Duplication, Consolidation, Refactoring, Architecture Compliance, Database Manager, Auth Client, Error Handler
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Each concept must have ONE canonical implementation per service - multiple implementations violate SSOT and create technical debt.
MANDATORY: SSOT fixes must be atomic - either completely fix all violations in a domain or report blockers.
Database connectivity must use single DatabaseManager in netra_backend/app/db/database_manager.py - delete all other managers.
Authentication must use single AuthServiceClient in auth_client_core.py - delete all shims and wrappers.
Error handling must use UnifiedErrorHandler in core/unified_error_handler.py - delete domain-specific handlers.
Environment access must use IsolatedEnvironment.get_env() - never use direct os.getenv() or os.environ.
When consolidating, provide backward compatibility wrappers to prevent breaking changes.
Delete duplicate implementations immediately - do not maintain legacy code per CLAUDE.md.
Run architecture compliance checks before every commit to prevent reintroduction of violations.

category.name: CORS SSOT Consolidation [RESOLVED]
category.keywords: CORS, Single Source of Truth, Origin Validation, shared/cors_config, validate_cors_origin, _is_valid_origin
category.critical-takeaway: RESOLVED 2025-08-25: Eliminated duplicate CORS origin validation functions in auth_service by consolidating to shared/cors_config.py
validate_cors_origin() and _is_valid_origin() now use shared is_origin_allowed() function instead of hardcoded origin lists
CORS origin configuration is now environment-aware through shared/cors_config.py with proper dev/staging/production origin lists
Canonical CORS configuration: shared/cors_config.py provides get_cors_origins() and is_origin_allowed() for all services
Auth service CORS consolidation maintains exact same security behavior while eliminating 20+ lines of duplicate origin lists
Environment-specific CORS behavior verified: development allows localhost, staging allows staging domains, production blocks all but production domains

category.name: Circular Import Detection
category.keywords: Circular Import, Import Error, Initialization, WebSocket, Synthetic Data
category.critical-takeaway: Standard import tests miss indirect circular imports through 4+ modules.
Use lazy imports (inside methods) for WebSocket manager in job/task managers.
Use TYPE_CHECKING guards for type hints in circular-prone modules.
Import tests MUST track full import chains, not just direct imports.

category.name: E2E Testing
category.keywords: End-to-End, Integration, Mock Mode, Database Session, TypeScript Exports, OAuth Testing, Agent Testing
category.critical-takeaway: Mock mode detection enables rapid testing without external dependencies.
Database session factories enable predictable test database state management.
TypeScript type vs runtime export separation prevents import errors and enables proper optimization.
OAuth tests must handle multiple valid failure modes (302, 401, 503) depending on configuration and state.
Agent system testing requires end-to-end patterns covering database persistence and WebSocket communication.
Complete module structures with proper exports prevent import failures and system integration issues.

category.name: E2E Test Infrastructure
category.keywords: E2E Tests, Test Infrastructure, Redis Async, Postgres Config, WebSocket Tests, Agent Orchestration, Test Collection
category.critical-takeaway: Use redis.asyncio for async Redis operations, not synchronous redis client with await.
PostgreSQL test connections must use port 5433 and load credentials from .env file.
Missing @dataclass decorators cause instantiation failures - verify all data classes have proper decorators.
Tests must gracefully handle unavailable services with skip messages, not failures.
Use absolute imports exclusively with test_framework.setup_test_path() for all test files.
Create centralized helper modules to reduce duplication across test categories.

category.name: Startup
category.keywords: Initialization, Boot, Config
category.critical-takeaway: Startup errors often cascade - fix configuration first, then secrets, then connections.

category.name: No Silent Fallbacks
category.keywords: Fallback, Default, Mock, Configuration, Database URL, Secrets, Loud Failure
category.critical-takeaway: CRITICAL: Never silently fall back to mock or default values for critical configuration - fail loudly and immediately.
Database URLs must be explicitly configured - no localhost:5432 defaults that mask real connection issues.
JWT secrets must be explicitly set - no dev-secret-key defaults that create security vulnerabilities.
Redis URLs must be explicitly configured - no localhost:6379 defaults that fail in containerized environments.
Service secrets and IDs must be explicitly configured - no dev defaults that prevent proper authentication.
Silent fallbacks mask real issues and make debugging exponentially harder - loud failures identify problems at their source.

category.name: Configuration-Logging Circular Dependency
category.keywords: Circular Dependency, Configuration, Logging, Loguru, Startup, Bootstrap
category.critical-takeaway: NEVER import logger directly in configuration modules - use lazy initialization to prevent circular dependencies.
Always provide print fallbacks for logging during bootstrap phase when logger may not be available.
Check loading flags (e.g., _loading) to prevent recursive initialization between interdependent systems.
Safe logging pattern: Try logger → fallback to print → handle all exceptions with print.
Test initialization order in staging-like environments to catch circular dependencies early.

category.name: State Management/Validation
category.keywords: Pydantic, Validation, State
category.critical-takeaway: Always provide defaults for Pydantic model fields unless absolutely critical.

category.name: Observability
category.keywords: Logging, Monitoring, Metrics
category.critical-takeaway: Implement modular observability architecture with correlation ID tracking.
Use f-strings or {} placeholders for loguru logging, not %s format strings (loguru-format-strings).

category.name: Environment Detection
category.keywords: Environment, Staging, Production
category.critical-takeaway: Environment defaults must NEVER be "production" - always default to staging for safety.

category.name: Bad Test Detection
category.keywords: Test Health, Flaky Tests
category.critical-takeaway: Track and fix consistently failing tests. Use bad test detection reports.

category.name: Demo Readiness
category.keywords: Demo, Presentation, Testing
category.critical-takeaway: Ensure comprehensive demo preparation with all features tested.

category.name: Scripting/Automation
category.keywords: Script, Shell, PowerShell, Bash, Python, Automation
category.critical-takeaway: ALWAYS use Python for scripts instead of shell/PowerShell for cross-platform compatibility.
Convert existing shell scripts to Python during refactoring.
Use subprocess.run() for external commands and pathlib for file operations.

category.name: Microservice Independence
category.keywords: Microservices, Independence, SSOT, Service Boundaries, Architecture
category.critical-takeaway: SSOT applies WITHIN services - each service maintains ONE canonical implementation per concept, cross-service patterns acceptable for independence.
Each microservice MUST maintain its own infrastructure code (database, config, monitoring) to preserve independence.
Services communicate via APIs, never through direct code imports across boundaries.
Similar code patterns across services is acceptable and often necessary for independence.

category.name: Database/CloudSQL
category.keywords: Cloud SQL, Database URL, Unix Socket, AsyncPG, PostgreSQL
